newsitem.title: USA: Universal Studios to extend Florida theme park.
newsitem.headline: Universal Studios to extend Florida theme park.

text.p: Universal Studios plans to announce a major new expansion to its Florida vacation theme park Tuesday, company officials said.
Film director Steven Spielberg, a creative consultant on the new $2.6 billion development, will take part in the announcement, Universal spokeswoman Yvonne Goforth said.
Universal was releasing no more details, but some accounts of the expansion have appeared in newspapers and trade publications in recent weeks.

Plans include a second Orlando theme park -- Islands of Adventure -- hotels and nightclubs. Together with the Universal Studios theme park, the resort will become known as Universal City Florida, according to the reports.
Islands of Adventure will feature five islands built around popular stories and characters such as Spiderman, Jurassic Park and the children's characters of Dr. Seuss, the reports said.
The company is expected to announce that Islands of Adventure will open in the summer of 1999.
Universal is 80 percent owned by Seagram Co Ltd. --Miami bureau (305) 374-5013
